name: dirs3arch
body:
dirs3arch
=========

Current Release: [dirs3arch v0.2.5 ((2014.9.2)](https://github.com/maurosoria/dirs3arch/releases/tag/v0.2.5)

Overview
--------
dirs3arch is a simple command line tool designed to brute force directories and files in websites.

Screenshots
-----------
Windows version:

![dirs3arch windows](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1757675/3620617/a4c2e278-0e03-11e4-9f56-a46f7b52d7f6.png)

Linux version:

![dirs3arch_linux](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1757675/3620618/a4cce58e-0e03-11e4-8eab-48c3a20eff85.png)


Operating Systems supported
---------------------------
- Windows XP/7/8
- GNU/Linux
- MacOSX


Features
--------
- Multithreaded
- Keep alive connections
- Support for multiple extensions (-e|--extensions asp,php)
- Reporting (plain text, JSON)
- Detect not found web pages when 404 not found errors are masked (.htaccess, web.config, etc).
- Recursive brute forcing
- HTTP(S) proxy support


Examples
----
**Scan www.example.com/admin/ to find php files:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/admin/ -e php`

**Scan www.example.com to find asp and aspx files with SSL:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u https://www.example.com/ -e asp,aspx`

**Scan www.example.com with an alternative dictionary (from DirBuster):**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/ -e php -w db/dirbuster/directory-list-2.3-small.txt`

**Scan with HTTP proxy (localhost port 8080):**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/admin/ -e php --http-proxy localhost:8080`

**Scan with custom User-Agent and custom header (Referer):**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/admin/ -e php --user-agent "My User-Agent" --header "Referer: www.google.com"`

**Scan recursively:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/admin/ -e php -r`

**Scan recursively excluding server-status directory and 200 status codes:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/ -e php -r --exclude-subdir "server-status" --exclude-status 200`

**Scan includes, classes directories in /admin/**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/admin/ -e php --scan-subdir "includes, classes"`

**Scan without following HTTP redirects:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/ -e php --no-follow-redirects`

**Scan VHOST "backend" at IP 192.168.1.1:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://backend/ --ip 192.168.1.1`

**Scan www.example.com to find wordpress plugins:**
`python dirs3arch.py -u http://www.example.com/wordpress/wp-content/plugins/ -e php -w db/wordpress/plugins.txt`


Changelog
---------
- 0.2.5 - 2014.9.2 Shows Content-Length in output and reports, added default.conf file (for setting defaults) and report auto save feature added.
- 0.2.4 - 2014.7.17 Added Windows support, --scan-subdir|--scan-subdirs argument added, --exclude-subdir|--exclude-subdirs added, --header argument added, dirbuster dictionaries added, fixed some concurrency bugs, MVC refactoring
- 0.2.3 - 2014.7.7 Fixed some bugs, minor refactorings, exclude status switch, "pause/next directory" feature, changed help structure, expaded default dictionary
- 0.2.2 - 2014.7.2 Fixed some bugs, showing percentage of tested paths and added report generation feature
- 0.2.1 - 2014.5.1 Fixed some bugs and added recursive option
- 0.2.0 - 2014.1.31 Initial public release
